verses.verse: A false<WH4820> balance<WH3976> is an abomination<WH8441> to Yahweh,<WH3068> but accurate<WH8003> weights<WH68> are his delight.<WH7522>
When pride<WH2087> comes,<WH935> then comes<WH935> shame,<WH7036> but with humility comes<WH935> wisdom.<WH2451>
The integrity<WH8538> of the upright<WH3477> shall guide<WH5148> them,<WH5558> but the perverseness of the treacherous<WH898> shall destroy them.<WH7703>
Riches<WH1952> don't<WH3276> profit in the day<WH3117> of wrath,<WH5678> but righteousness<WH6666> delivers<WH5337> from death.<WH4194>
The righteousness<WH6666> of the blameless<WH8549> will direct<WH3474> his way,<WH1870> but the wicked<WH7563> shall fall<WH5307> by his own wickedness.<WH7564>
The righteousness<WH6666> of the upright<WH3477> shall deliver<WH5337> them,<WH898> but the unfaithful will be trapped<WH3920> by evil desires.<WH1942>
When a wicked<WH7563> man<WH120> dies,<WH4194> hope<WH8615> perishes,<WH6> and expectation<WH8615> of power<WH205> comes to nothing.<WH6>
A righteous<WH6662> person is delivered out<WH2502> of trouble,<WH6869> and the wicked<WH7563> takes his place.<WH7563>
With his mouth<WH6310> the godless<WH2611> man destroys<WH7843> his neighbor,<WH7453> but the righteous<WH6662> will be delivered<WH2502> through knowledge.<WH1847>
When it goes well<WH2898> with the righteous,<WH6662> the city<WH7151> rejoices.<WH5970> When the wicked<WH7563> perish,<WH6> there is shouting.<WH7440>
By the blessing<WH1293> of the upright,<WH3477> the city<WH7176> is exalted,<WH7311> but it is overthrown<WH2040> by the mouth<WH6310> of the wicked.<WH7563>
One who despises<WH936> his neighbor<WH7453> is void<WH2638> of wisdom,<WH3820> but a man<WH376> of understanding<WH8394> holds his peace.<WH2790>
One who brings gossip<WH1980> betrays<WH1540> a confidence,<WH5475> but one who is of a trustworthy<WH539> spirit<WH7307> is one who keeps<WH3680> a secret.<WH1697>
Where there is no wise guidance,<WH8458> the nation<WH5971> falls,<WH5307> but in the multitude<WH7230> of counselors<WH3289> there is victory.<WH8668>
He who is collateral<WH6148> for a stranger<WH2114> will suffer<WH7321> for it,<WH8130> but he who refuses pledges of collateral<WH8628> is secure.<WH982>
A gracious<WH2580> woman<WH802> obtains<WH8551> honor,<WH3519> but violent<WH6184> men obtain<WH8551> riches.<WH6239>
The merciful<WH2617> man<WH376> does good<WH1580> to his own soul,<WH5315> but he who is cruel<WH394> troubles<WH5916> his own flesh.<WH7607>
Wicked<WH7563> people earn<WH6213> deceitful<WH8267> wages,<WH6468> but one who sows<WH2232> righteousness<WH6666> reaps a sure<WH571> reward.<WH7938>
He who is truly righteous<WH6666> gets life.<WH2416> He who pursues<WH7291> evil<WH7451> gets death.<WH4194>
Those who are perverse<WH6141> in heart<WH3820> are an abomination<WH8441> to Yahweh,<WH3068> but those whose ways<WH1870> are blameless<WH8549> are his delight.<WH7522>
Most<WH3027> certainly,<WH3027> the evil<WH7451> man will not be unpunished,<WH5352> but the seed<WH2233> of the righteous<WH6662> will be delivered.<WH4422>
Like a gold<WH2091> ring<WH5141> in a pig<WH2386>'s snout,<WH639> is a beautiful<WH3303> woman<WH802> who lacks<WH5493> discretion.<WH2940>
The desire<WH8378> of the righteous<WH6662> is only good.<WH2896> The expectation<WH8615> of the wicked<WH7563> is wrath.<WH5678>
There is<WH3426> one who scatters,<WH6340> and increases<WH3254> yet more.<WH3476> There is one who withholds more than is appropriate, but gains poverty.<WH4270>
The liberal<WH1293> soul<WH5315> shall be made fat.<WH1878> He who waters<WH7301> shall be watered also himself.<WH3384>
People<WH3816> curse<WH5344> someone who withholds<WH4513> grain,<WH1250> but blessing<WH1293> will be on the head<WH7218> of him who sells it.<WH7666>
He who diligently seeks<WH7836> good<WH2896> seeks<WH7836> favor,<WH7522> but he who searches<WH1875> after evil,<WH7451> it shall come to him.<WH935>
He who trusts<WH982> in his riches<WH6239> will fall,<WH5307> but the righteous<WH6662> shall flourish<WH6524> as the green leaf.<WH5929>
He who troubles<WH5916> his own house<WH1004> shall inherit<WH5157> the wind.<WH7307> The foolish<WH191> shall be servant<WH5650> to the wise<WH2450> of heart.<WH3820>
The fruit<WH6529> of the righteous<WH6662> is a tree<WH6086> of life.<WH2416> He who is wise<WH2450> wins<WH3947> souls.<WH5315>
Behold,<WH6662> the righteous shall be repaid<WH7999> in the earth;<WH776> how much more the wicked<WH7563> and the sinner!<WH2398>
